name: France
clue1: This country has over 1,500 different types of cheese
clue2: Home to the world's most visited museum
clue3: Known for its fashion industry and haute couture
clue4: Famous for its wine regions like Bordeaux and Champagne
clue5: Has the highest mountain in Western Europe
clue6: Its capital city is known as the City of Light
clue7: Home to the Palace of Versailles
clue8: The national motto is Liberté, Égalité, Fraternité
clue9: Has a famous tower built for the 1889 World's Fair
clue10: This country is shaped like a hexagon

name: Japan
clue1: Home to Mount Fuji, an iconic active volcano
clue2: Has the busiest train station in the world
clue3: Consists of over 6,800 islands
clue4: Famous for its cherry blossom festivals
clue5: Exports high-quality sushi and seafood worldwide
clue6: Known for its anime and manga industry
clue7: The flag is a white background with a red circle
clue8: Has the world's oldest continuously operating company
clue9: Home to the world's busiest pedestrian crossing
clue10: This country hosted the 2020 Summer Olympics

name: United States
clue1: The third most populous country in the world
clue2: Has the longest river system in North America
clue3: Shares the longest international border with Canada
clue4: Contains the Grand Canyon, one of the Seven Natural Wonders
clue5: Largest producer of Hollywood films
clue6: Birthplace of fast food chains like McDonald's and KFC
clue7: The flag has 50 stars and 13 stripes
clue8: First country to land humans on the moon
clue9: Home to Silicon Valley, the tech capital of the world
clue10: Has the world's largest economy

name: Brazil
clue1: Home to the Amazon Rainforest, the largest in the world
clue2: Has the world's most famous Carnival festival
clue3: Borders every South American country except Chile and Ecuador
clue4: Contains the Pantanal, the world's largest tropical wetland
clue5: The largest exporter of coffee in the world
clue6: Football (soccer) is the most popular sport here
clue7: The flag is green with a yellow diamond
clue8: The only Portuguese-speaking country in South America
clue9: Hosted the FIFA World Cup in 2014
clue10: This country is home to the Christ the Redeemer statue

name: Australia
clue1: Has the world's largest coral reef system
clue2: Home to the world's deadliest animals, including box jellyfish
clue3: A continent and a country in one
clue4: Contains the Outback, a vast desert region
clue5: One of the biggest exporters of wool
clue6: Famous for its Aboriginal art and culture
clue7: The flag contains the Union Jack in the top left corner
clue8: The only country to be home to kangaroos and koalas
clue10: This country celebrates Australia Day on January 26

name: India
clue1: The second most populous country in the world
clue2: Has the longest rail network in Asia
clue3: Borders Pakistan, China, Nepal, Bhutan, Bangladesh, and Myanmar
clue4: Contains the Himalayas, the tallest mountain range
clue5: Largest producer of spices
clue6: Home to Bollywood, the largest film industry
clue7: Has a navy blue wheel (Ashoka Chakra) in the center
clue8: World's largest democracy
clue10: This country has the Taj Mahal

name: Germany
clue1: Has the largest economy in Europe
clue2: Famous for its Autobahn highway with no speed limit
clue3: Shares borders with 9 different countries
clue4: Home to the Black Forest and Bavarian Alps
clue5: World's largest car exporter
clue6: Known for Oktoberfest and beer culture
clue7: The flag has black, red, and gold stripes
clue8: Invented the printing press
clue10: This country was once divided into East and West

name: South Africa
clue1: Has three capital cities
clue2: Home to the 'Big Five' safari animals
clue3: Borders Namibia, Botswana, Zimbabwe, Mozambique, Eswatini, and Lesotho
clue4: Contains Table Mountain, a famous landmark
clue5: A major exporter of gold and diamonds
clue6: Famous for Nelson Mandela and apartheid history
clue7: Has six colors on its flag, the most of any national flag
clue8: First country to voluntarily give up nuclear weapons
clue10: Hosted the 2010 FIFA World Cup

name: Mexico
clue1: Home to the largest pyramid in the world
clue2: Has the world's second most museums per city
clue3: Borders the United States, Guatemala, and Belize
clue4: Contains the Yucatán Peninsula and Sierra Madre mountains
clue5: Exports the most avocados in the world
clue6: Famous for Mariachi music and Day of the Dead
clue7: The flag features an eagle devouring a snake
clue8: The Aztecs founded its capital on a lake
clue10: This country gave the world tacos and tequila
